file_content.text: This place will be an Imperial territory before the year's out.
Hah. I recommended the lot of you for medals.
Hah. I thought about asking for a medal, my lord, but I figured that was probably beneath your dignity.
Hah. I asked to have you on track for a medal, but the Intelligence service declined.
Hah. I tried to get them to give you a medal, but they said that's reserved for commissioned officers.
Our spy droids are already picking up a change in the chatter. Villages talking about surrendering rather than starve.
I assume we have you to thank?
This insurgency will resist us no longer.
We all serve the Empire.
Puddle farmers and tusk-faced morons cannot stand against the might of the Empire.
I'd rather not have my name attached, you know?
No thanks necessary.
I'll be happy to take the credit.
Your soldiers need serious training if those guys bested them.
I'm way better than your men.
Not exactly the best and the brightest who get shipped here. Maybe a march out to view your handiwork will inspire them.
All that's left is wreckage and corpses.
I made short work of them.
That's what I like to hear.
Let's talk credits.
With thanks. Bounties for every caravan that's gone off our radar.
Without the support of the Exchange, this planet will be swearing allegiance to the Emperor before you can say "aerial bombardment."
The caravans usually stay clear of our patrols.
Get a shuttle out here to evac the wounded. Corpses stay 'til we've assessed the threat condition.
Now! Don't stand there like some drooling sand-rat, you're an Imperial soldier!
My apologies. This is hardly the way I'd like to introduce my troops to such an illustrious group.
I'm sorry you had to see this, my lord. Not one of our army's finer moments.
If you're here to see our successes in annexing Tatooine, it may be a short visit. We're having a hard time out here.
You here on your own, or did you come to help? I hear you've done the Empire a service or two.
What fools attack the Imperial Army?
Who did this to you?
Well-armed fools, courtesy of the Exchange.
At least half the dead are yours.
Your troops seem outmatched.
Yes, well, my troops are game, but they're the greenest thing you'll find in this desert, and the Exchange is more than they're up for.
Why are you talking to me?
You should care. The Exchange is our biggest obstacle to claiming this dustball for the glorious Empire.
Ever run into them? Nasty crime syndicate, likes to use Tatooine as a waypoint.
These criminals don't want this rock under Imperial control, so they've been stirring up local resistance.
It is in all of our interests to extend the grip of the Empire.
Can I assist?
If you go after them, my lord, they won't last long enough to call for their mothers. No stupid tusker's going to stand against a Sith.
I've been known to do a little counter-insurgency in my day....
I might be able to help.
The insurgency's less of a problem than the Exchange. Without their support, the locals'll fold like clean laundry.
You looking to take out someone specific?
Anything in my field?
I don't have names or anything, but, sure, there's a job here if you're looking.
This is one of the caravans the Exchange is using to supply the insurgents. Heavy guard, all tuskers. Each one we've taken costs us dear.
What exactly happened here?
Those guys don't look local.
The Exchange has been using these caravans to supply the insurgency and keep it active.
Every one is guarded by these Exchange tuskers--they're too big to hurt and too dumb to scare, so each one we take down costs us.
I was about to tell command we'd need a new combat battalion if we want to take them on, but... any chance you'd like to lend some expertise?
No petty criminals can be allowed to tie the hands of the Empire.
They must be taught a lesson.
If the price is right, your caravans are history.
Sure. I'm in.
What do I get out of this?
The thanks of a grateful Empire? No? Hm... what do you get the man who has everything?
My men got a bonus for every caravan they shut down. If you step up, the reward money's yours, and well-deserved.
You want to help, go follow the caravan routes and take down as many as you can. The locals will assume the Exchange abandoned them.
Then we'll see how quickly those puddle farmers beg us to take them over.
Not my thing. [Refuse quest]
As long as you're here, it's all of our problem.
This territory is closed to all but Imperial citizens!
